betray.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset
betray.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He felt that she had betrayed him.
She had betrayed her parents' trust.
I would never betray a confidence  (=tell a secret that someone has trusted me with).
What kind of man would betray his own sister to the police?
betray.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to be disloyal to your country, company etc, for example by giving secret information to its enemies
betray.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: people who betray their country for money
betray.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to show feelings that you are trying to hide
betray.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: His face betrayed nothing  (=showed no emotion).
betray.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to show that something is true or exists, especially when it is not easily noticed
betray.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The slightest sound might betray his presence.
The crumpled sheets betrayed the fact that someone had been sleeping there.
